articles.title: Congratulations to President of Benin
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Benin
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Thomas Boni Yayi, president of Benin, on the latter's  election as president of the African Union at the 18th ordinary session of the assembly of heads of state and government of the AU. 
					The message highly appreciated the fact that the AU summit discussed and decided on important issues of ensuring regional peace and stability through their concerted efforts and achieving socio-economic development in line with the will and desire of the member nations and expressed full support and solidarity with it. 
					
					Reiterating the stand of the DPRK government to steadily boost the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation with the African countries, Kim hoped that its member nations would achieve unity and solidarity and great successes in attaining the noble goal of the AU to build powerful Africa thanks to his positive efforts.

articles.title: DWUK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DWUK Delegation Back Home
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea led by Vice-Chairwoman of its Central Committee Chae Chun Hui returned home on Sunday after participating in the meeting of the Executive Committee of the Women's International Democratic Federation held in Lisbon of Portugal.

articles.title: New Book on Revolutionary Anecdotes of Kim Jong Il Off Press
articles.content:
New Book on Revolutionary Anecdotes of Kim Jong Il Off Press
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out 12 volumes of book "General Kim Jong Il, Sun of Songun," a library of revolutionary anecdotes, on the occasion of the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					More than 3 080 stories were selected from among revolutionary anecdotes of Kim Jong Il. They were compiled in 12 volumes in the order of 365 days. Each volume contains those in every month. 
					
					Given in the book are titles and origin of more than 1 070 major works authored by Kim Jong Il in respective days. It deals with some units honored with field guidance provided by him in respective days.
					
					Revolutionary anecdotes including "Mission of Philosophy", "Banner of Songun" and "Our Life Is Songun Politics" deal with the facts that Kim Jong Il perfectly formulated the Juche idea, Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung so that they might serve as an invincible banner for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence.
					
					The revolutionary anecdotes including "First Trip to Mt. Paektu", "Don't Waver ", "Meandering River Amnok" and "100 Percent Inheritance and Materialization" help readers deeply grasp the exploits and efforts of Kim Jong Il who made sure that the revolutionary tradition of Mt. Paektu was given steady continuity to be an eternal lifeblood for the Korean revolution.
					
					They tell impressive stories about how energetically Kim Jong Il led the party building and its activities under the uplifted banner of modeling the whole society on the Juche idea.
					
					The revolutionary anecdotes including "Height 351 in the Eastern Sector of Front", "Steep Road along Mt. Osong", "Cheers at Panmunjom" and "Launch of 'Kwangmyongsong-2'" impressively deal with the undying feats performed by Kim Jong Il in the course of long journeys for Songun.
					
					Kim Jong Il made a trip aboard a train to provide field guidance despite pent-up fatigue till the last moments of his life. By doing so, he made the torch of a great revolutionary surge flare up furiously on all fronts of socialist construction.
					
					Among his revolutionary anecdotes are those which deal with his revolutionary activities in those days touching the people. They include "'Forced March Braving Snowstorm'", "Appearing in the East and in the West", "Contest among Four Factories", "CNC Bears Witness to Personality of Great Man" and "The 11th Scenery of Songun-Vast Orchards of Apple Trees in Full Bloom".
					
					"O, National Reunification!", "Boundless Magnanimity", "Anecdotes of June 15 Reunification", "Homeland and Chongryon" and "Relief Fund" and other revolutionary anecdotes deal with legendary historical facts. They tell about Kim Jong Il's noble patriotism and love for the nation.
					
					"2 a.m. in an Island Country", "Lesson Drawn from 'Caribbean Crisis'", "Bringing a 'Spring' of Socialism", "From Frustration to Advance", "Tears Shed by a Siberian Man", "Day and Night in the Far East", etc. deal with the great contribution made by Kim Jong Il to accomplishing the human cause of independence.
					
					"Paean", "Smiling Sun", "Unchangeable Salute", "Eternal President of the DPRK", "We Miss the President Very Much" and many other revolutionary anecdotes tell about Kim Jong Il's intense loyalty to the President.
					
					The book contains stories about boundless respect, trust and loving care shown by Kim Jong Il for anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, revolutionary comrades and soldiers. They are compiled as a collection of anecdotes.

articles.title: Minju Joson Condemns S. Korean Authorities' Unethical Actions
articles.content:
Minju Joson Condemns S. Korean Authorities' Unethical Actions
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Central District Court of south Korea on Feb. 8 issued a warrant of arrest for two members of the Council for Promoting the Reunification of Our Nation by Federal Formula on the charge of violating the "National Security Law" (NSL). They were reported to have tried to set up an incense-burning altar in December last year. 
					Meanwhile, the prosecution is also mulling arresting members of the Association of Victims of NSL on the same charge. 
					
					Minju Joson Sunday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					It was a just deed reflecting the mindset of the people that the above-said members tried to set up incense-burning altars to mourn the passing of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					It is an elementary moral obligation for Koreans to express condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					The members of the above-said organizations tried to set up altars as required by the mindset of the people. This deed should be encouraged in the light of not only ancestral beautiful manners and customs but also the desire of the Koreans for improved inter-Korean relations. Nevertheless, the group of traitors is set to suppress them on the charge of violation of the NSL. These are unpardonable acts against ethics and reunification that only add to its crimes. 
					
					The suppression of the progressive forces for reforms intensified by the group by invoking the NSL is nothing but desperate efforts of those in the grip of a crisis. 
					
					The aim sought by the group is to create fascist terror-ridden atmosphere under the pretence of security and harshly suppress the progressive forces for reforms in a bid to tide over its ruling crisis and win the forthcoming "National Assembly" election come what may. 
					
					However, it is sadly mistaken. 
					
					The group of traitors would be well advised to step down of their own accord before facing a stern punishment by the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Accuses Authorities of Blocking North-south Contact
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Accuses Authorities of Blocking North-south Contact
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) --The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Thursday in an editorial denounced the authorities for blocking north-south contact. 
					Recalling that representatives of more than 200 political parties and organizations Wednesday held a joint meeting at which they proposed the authorities to take measures for bringing about a drastic turn in the inter-Korean relations, the editorial went on:
					
					The authorities have allowed neither full-fledged cooperation nor exchange. Worse still, they refused the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to have working contact with the north side. 
					
					While asserting that "dialogue between authorities should precede", the south Korean authorities set it as preconditions for the north to make an apology for "Cheonan" warship case, etc. the thing absolutely unacceptable to the north side, making it impossible to have any contact. 
					
					The authorities stressed the need to meet before solving any issue and then they insisted the controversial problem should be solved before anything else if the north side wants to meet the south side. This incoherent attitude can only be interpreted as urging the north to make a political surrender. 
					
					This stance of the "government" which must know this may be a deliberate strategy to shun dialogue, in fact. 
					
					If the regime truly wants to settle the inter-Korean relations, it should put forward civilians actively and listen to their voices.

articles.title: S. Korean National Intelligence Service's Suppression of Pro-Reunification Figures under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean National Intelligence Service's Suppression of Pro-Reunification Organization under Fire
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. issued a statement on Feb. 8, assailing the south Korean Intelligence Service's anachronistic suppression of organization of the peace movement.
					The statement said that day the IS took such fascist action as forcibly searching the houses of leading members of the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the organization's offices.
					
					The IS took such action against them on charges of violation of the "National Security Law", insisting that all the activities of the organization including the struggle for concluding a peace agreement on the Korean Peninsula, the actions for curbing the naval base construction on Jeju Island, the movement for getting the "UN Command" disbanded, etc. were conducted by the instructions from the north, the statement said, adding:
					
					The Korean nation is strongly opposed to war.
					
					The IS is the nation's enemy as it deserves a punishment by the people because it has cracked down upon the organization while bringing false charges against the organization which has conducted patriotic and peace-loving activities for the nation against war. 
					
					The people are well aware of the despicable plots hatched by the IS to create a terror-ridden atmosphere for suppression by invoking the NSL in a bid to save the present ruling party in the grip of a crisis at the forthcoming April general election.
					
					The people's desire for the country's independence and peaceful reunification against war is growing stronger as the days go by and the organization will wage a more dynamic movement against war despite any suppression, concluded the statement.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Mark Day of Shining Star
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia held a meeting on February 9 to mark the Day of the Shining Star.
					The participants paid tribute to leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Speakers at the meeting said that they were observing the first Day of the Shining Star after the untimely passing of Kim Jong Il, father of the nation.
					
					They praised Kim Jong Il as the greatest man in history.
					
					They spoke highly of Kim Jong Il who, identical to President Kim Il Sung, protected the dignity of the DPRK and wisely led the people in the hard period when the moves of the imperialist allied forces to isolate and stifle it got more desperate than ever before and the international situation remained most complicated.
					
					The DPRK is now shining thanks to the immortal exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					They expressed belief that the revolutionary cause of Juche would be successfully carried forward and the reunification of the country, the ardent desire of Kim Jong Il, would be surely achieved under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un standing at the helm of the revolution.
					
					Overseas compatriots will wage a more dynamic movement for reunification, holding high the banner of "By our nation itself", they stressed.

articles.title: Functions to Commemorate Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Held Abroad
articles.content:
Functions to Commemorate Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Held Abroad
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Events took place to commemorate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il on Feb. 2 and 3. They include meetings, film shows, book and photo exhibitions held in Poland, Norway, Cambodia and Thailand and at the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement.
					On display in their venues were works of Kim Jong Il, photos showing his immortal exploits, books and photos introducing the achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation.
					
					The participants of the film shows watched Korean films including "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and others.
					
					The first vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association said:
					
					The Polish people who received news of the demise of Comrade Kim Jong Il so untimely last year shared sorrow with the Korean people.
					
					Today the Korean people turned out to build a thriving nation to carry out the behests of Kim Jong Il under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					Kim Jong Il will always be alive in the hearts of humankind as a lodestar shedding its bright rays.
					
					Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, noted:
					
					Comrade Kim Jong Il was a great teacher and peerlessly political elder who instilled strength and courage into the Korean and other progressive people of the world.
					
					We will extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just cause.
					
					A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting held in Norway.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Cambodia, Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Cambodia, Ethiopia
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Meetings for remembering leader Kim Jong Il were held by the Khmer Democratic Party and the Funcinpec Party of Cambodia and a branch of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea on Feb. 3 and 6.
					Ouk Phurik, president of the Khmer Democratic Party of Cambodia, said:
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il was, indeed, a great man who was identical to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					He always extended positive support and encouragement to the cause of Great King Norodom Sihanouk and the Cambodian people.
					
					The Cambodian people always feel grateful for this and will remember this forever.
					
					The secretary general of the party noted: Kim Jong Il was a distinguished great man who boundlessly loved the people and devoted his all to them. He made a great contribution to developing the friendly relations between Cambodia and the DPRK.
					
					The executive chairman of the Funcinpec Party of Cambodia again expressed deep condolences to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people over the demise of Kim Jong Il on behalf of all its members.
					
					The chief of a branch of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea said that the feats performed by Kim Jong Il will last forever.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked by Papers of Indonesia, Pakistan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked by Papers of Indonesia, Pakistan
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Papers of Indonesia and Pakistan on Feb. 6 carried special write-ups on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The Indonesian paper The First Times allotted its one whole page to a special write-up illustrated with the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and photo showing revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					The paper said:
					
					Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un is another Kim Jong Il for the Korean people.
					
					He is possessed of versatile and profound knowledge about the political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields.
					
					In the course of accompanying Kim Jong Il during his ceaseless field guidance, Kim Jong Un displayed extraordinary ideological and theoretical wisdom, distinguished leadership art, ardent love for the people and noble personality and was profoundly respected and revered by them.
					
					The Korean people will accomplish the cause of building a thriving nation and the cause of national reunification without fail under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					No force on earth can arrest the advance of the Korean people rallied close around him.
					
					The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times carried an article praising the undying feats of Kim Jong Il who was born in Mt. Paektu and devoted his all to the country and the revolution and the people's happiness in the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: DPRK's Songun Politics Lauded by Foreign Political Party Leaders
articles.content:
DPRK's Songun Politics Lauded by Foreign Political Party Leaders
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Roberto Gabriele, general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, issued a statement on Feb. 6 on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					He praised Kim Jong Il as an extraordinary thinker and theoretician and outstanding statesman.
					
					The Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il is the basic political mode of socialist Korea, he said, and went on:
					
					The Songun politics helped the DPRK remarkably bolster its defense capability and demonstrate its might as a military power which no formidable enemy dares attack.
					
					The present complicated international political situation clearly proves how just the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il is.
					
					Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, and Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee Bangladesh National Socialist Party, issued a joint statement on the same day.
					
					The Songun politics pursued by the dear respected Kim Jong Un by carrying forward the cause of Kim Jong Il is increasing the hope for the future of the progressive people who want to live in an independent new world, the statement stressed.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Japan
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Japan
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Kyoto Prefectural Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung was formed in Japan on Feb. 2.
					Takashi Ishida, ex-president of the Kyoto Prefectural Assembly, was elected representative member of the committee.
					
					The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful events on the occasion of the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Observed in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Observed in Democratic Congo
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Congo preparatory committee for the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il issued a bulletin on Feb. 2 on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.
					Under the headline "Comrade Kim Jong Il Will Always Be Alive in the Hearts of Progressive Humankind" the bulletin carried articles including the one captioned "The Day of the Shining Star." 
					
					It praised the undying ideological and theoretical feats Kim Jong Il performed by comprehensively developing in depth the Juche idea, Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					He safeguarded socialism and justice from the vicious moves of the imperialists to stifle it and led the cause of global independence to victory by enforcing Songun politics and in this course performed great exploits before the era and history, the bulletin noted, and continued:
					
					His idea and cause would be successfully inherited and accomplished under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					The bulletin also carried a special report of the Political Bureau of Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Posted on Internet Homepage in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage in Peru
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Having a Correct Understanding of Nationalism" was posted on the Internet homepage by the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship on Feb. 4.

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Introduced in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Introduced in Democratic Congo
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Congo preparatory committee for commemorating the 70th birth anniversary of Leader Kim Jong Il posted his brief biography on its bulletin on Feb. 2.

articles.title: Oath-taking Meeting Held in Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Oath-taking Meeting Held in Mt. Paektu
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- A meeting to vow loyalty took place in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu, a holy land of revolution, on Sunday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, the Day of the Shining Star, the greatest holiday of the nation.
					Attending the meeting were Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Jong Gak, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae and officials of Party and armed forces organs and  working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and people from all walks of life.
					
					The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Speeches were made there.
					
					Vice Marshal Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, said that the birth of Kim Jong Il was the great jubilee and fortune of the nation which greeted the peerlessly Songun sun and a worldwide event which promised the bright future of progressive mankind aspiring after independence.
					
					Kim Jong Il made tireless efforts for increasing the military capability with the steadfast faith that the army guarantees the prosperity of the country and happiness of its people, he noted.
					
					Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, said that thanks to the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il, the WPK has developed into an invincible party and genuine mother party and guiding force of the Songun politics and it is shedding its rays as a dignified and sovereign party of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					He stressed the need to cherish the invariable faith that Kim Jong Il will always be with us and uphold him in high esteem for all ages and fully and unconditionally implement his last instructions. 
					
					Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said the youth marking the significant Day of the Shining Star in the sacred land of the revolution where the great sun of Songun was born miss Kim Jong Il very much.
					
					He stressed the need for all members of the young vanguard to firmly unite around the dear respected Kim Jong Un and accomplish the cause of the Juche revolution started in Mt. Paektu, true to the last instructions of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Fireworks were displayed in the sky above the secret camp to present fantastic scenery in the deep forest at night. The participants broke into loud shouts of "hurrah!" watching them.

articles.title: Russia to Bolster Air Force
articles.content:
Russia to Bolster Air Force
Moscow, February 11 (KCNA) -- Russia is exerting efforts to bolster its air force. The Defense Ministry of Russia is to receive 10 "Su-34" fighter bombers this year. 
					It was reported that in the future, all the "Su-24" fighters of the air force would be replaced by "Su-34" fighter bombers. 
					
					Meanwhile, Russia plans test flight of the fourth trial fighter of the fifth generation "PAK FA T-50".

articles.title: Singapore FM Says U.S. Should Avoid Anti-China Rhetoric
articles.content:
Singapore FM Says U.S. Should Avoid Anti-China Rhetoric
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Singapore's Foreign Minister K. Shanmugam has said that the United States should not underestimate the impact of the anti-China rhetoric, local media reported on Thursday.
					Domestic pressures in the United States, especially in the election year, have resulted in some anti-China rhetoric in domestic debates, Shanmugam, who was on his visit to the United States, told a conference on Wednesday at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.
					
					International media such as AFP also noticed that there has been an increase in anti-China rhetoric from some lawmakers.
					
					"Americans should not underestimate the extent to which such rhetoric can spark reaction which can create a new and unintended reality for the region," he said.
					
					The Singapore foreign minister said the United States should respect the diversity of the systems across Asia when interacting with the different countries and regions in the region.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Man-killings in Different Parts of World under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Man-killings in Different Parts of World under Fire
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, south Korean Internet newspaper, posted an article on February 9 denouncing the U.S. imperialists for killing civilians by use of their drones in different parts of the world.
					The article referred to the fact that an international media organization on February 7 said drones of the U.S. perpetrated indiscriminate air raids on civilians in other countries under the pretext of anti-terrorism, claiming huge casualties. The number of the civilians killed by drones during the office of the present U.S. president reached hundreds, among them dozens of children, the article noted, and continued:
					
					Drones committed precision air raids not only on the civilians who tried to help victims of bombing but also on participants of funeral services.
					
					As regards such drone attacks, the U.S. claimed that they caused not many civilian casualties as drone operations are conducted on the basis of correctly set targets. The U.S. is so brazen-faced as to claim that it has the right to unilaterally attack terrorists everywhere in the world.
					
					Saying that many international law experts are branding drone attacks as state sponsored man-killings, the article queried what the U.S. will do if it is exposed to such attack.
					
					The international community is pushing ahead with a plan to take restrictive measures in the light of dangerous use of drones, it added.

articles.title: 4 Killed in U.S. Drone Strike in NW Pakistan
articles.content:
4 Killed in U.S. Drone Strike in NW Pakistan
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan killed Pakistanis again on February 9 under the signboard of "anti-terrorism".
					At least four people were killed and two others were injured when a U.S. drone fired missiles in North Waziristan tribal area of northwest Pakistan on Thursday morning, local media reported.

articles.title: U.S. Intends to Draw Arabs into Dangerous Game: Iran
articles.content:
U.S. Intends to Draw Arabs into Dangerous Game: Iran
Tehran, February 11 (KCNA) -- Islamic Revolution Guards Corps Naval Force Commander Admiral Ali Fadavi on Feb. 7 has warned that the United States intends to involve certain Arab nations in its dangerous game in the Middle East, while Washington has intensified its economic and financial sanctions against the Persian nation.
					Admiral Fadavi said that the U.S. government tries to achieve its goals and push through its satanic policies with the financial assistance of Arab governments.
					
					The top IRGC Navy commander said that Iran's policy is based on interaction and cooperation with countries in Persian Gulf region in line with common interests, calling to join forces against the interference policies on the enemy.

articles.title: Iranian Diplomat Warns of Retaliatory Strikes If U.S. Attacks
articles.content:
Iranian Diplomat Warns of Retaliatory Strikes If U.S. Attacks
Moscow, February 11 (KCNA) -- Iran has the potential to retaliate against U.S. forces anywhere in the world, the Iranian ambassador to Moscow said Wednesday.
					He said an American attack on Iran would be "a huge mistake."
					
					Still, the ambassador said Teheran had no intention to launch first strikes against the countries that could offer their territory to U.S. forces.
					
					"Attacking Iran is a suicide for them," Sajjadi said.

articles.title: Ukrainian President Calls for Accelerating Army Reform
articles.content:
Ukrainian President Calls for Accelerating Army Reform
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- President Viktor Yanukovych on Thursday called on Ukraine's armed forces to press ahead with reforms in 2012.
					"The Defense Ministry and the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine have to prepare jointly a realistic concept of radical and effective reform of the Ukrainian army," Yanukovych said during a presentation of new Defense Minister Dmytro Salamatin.
					
					The reforms are aimed at creating "compact and effective" armed forces that can protect the national interests of Ukraine, the president said.
					
					He stressed the need to increase the intensity of combat training of troops and army financing.

articles.title: Bolivia Accuses U.S. of Spying on Latin America
articles.content:
Bolivia Accuses U.S. of Spying on Latin America
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Bolivian President Evo Morales on Thursday accused the United States of spying on his and other Latin American countries.
					The Bolivian president said the spying is done under the cover of the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) and other non-governmental organizations (NGOs).
					
					"I am convinced that some NGOs, especially those funded by the USAID, are the fifth column of espionage in Bolivia, not only in Bolivia, but also in all of Latin America," Morales said during a press conference in Oruro, a southwestern Bolivian city.
					
					Morales said the United States, through the cover of development aid operations of those organizations, knows "all the details of the activities of the social sectors and union leaders" in those Latin American countries.
					
					The president regretted that some union leaders were allegedly used by these NGOs to stir disputes such as the one over a highway project in an indigenous territory in his country.

articles.title: Colombia Supports Cuba's Fight against Blockade, FM Says
articles.content:
Colombia Supports Cuba's Fight against Blockade, FM Says
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Colombian Foreign Minister, Maria Angela Holguin, on Wednesday ratified her country's support to Cuba in the fight against U.S. economic, trade and financial blockade.
					"You can be sure that we always will support you in that cause", Holguin stated during her official visit to Cuba.

articles.title: Palestine Refutes Israel's Threats
articles.content:
Palestine Refutes Israel's Threats
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Palestinian representative at the United Nations, Riyad Mansour, defended the commitment between the movements Al-Fatah and Hamas to form an interim government, and rejected Israel's threats to abort the agreement.
					When asked about how the ANP and particularly Abbas will react to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's warning that it will have to choose between peace with Hamas or peace with Israel, Mansour responded with a scathing assessment.
					
					Israel is always the enemy, Israel is always the occupying power, it is and will always be an obstacle in our path, and that is our destiny, to fight with all our power and support from all our friends to succeed in ending the occupation.

articles.title: Okinawa Seeks Early Return of U.S. Military Land under New Deal
articles.content:
Okinawa Seeks Early Return of U.S. Military Land under New Deal
Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Okinawa Gov. Hirokazu Nakaima and other local officials reiterated their opposition to the two countries' maintained policy of moving the U.S. Marine Corps' Futenma Air Station within the prefecture.
					Nakaima said in his statement on Wednesday he expects Tokyo and Washington to ''reflect the view of local people'' in reviewing their 2006 agreement on the realignment of U.S. forces in Japan, which links the Futenma relocation with the return of military-occupied land south of the Kadena base and the transfer of Marines stationed in Okinawa to Guam.
